__TOC__


 Contact: MickPatten
 Make: ASUS
 Model: A4L (4000 Series)

=== Current Issues ===
* NDIS driver used for wireless NIC - no "true" Linux hardware support.

* SD/MMC cardreader is sensitive and sometimes won't detect an inserted card. I think it's dependent on the card format - haven't investigated further.

* Intrepid (alpha6) sometimes doesn't show suspend or hibernate option(s) under shutdown - annoying thing is it shows less than 5 mins later...

=== System Info ===
System Manufacturer: ASUSTeK Computer Inc.
Product Name : A4L
System Version : 1.0

==== Notes ====
Manually set resolution through ''xorg.conf'' (1280x800).

Ricoh Co Ltd RL5c476 II Cardreader (Yenta Cardbus)
<pre>
Add to /etc/modules:
sudo modprobe tifm_core
sudo modprobe tifm_sd
</pre>

Wireless NIC (SIS162u 802.11b USB) uses WinXP NDIS driver.

Enable HyperThreading (tested on II only - should also be available on HH)
<pre>
Add 'ht=on' to your '/boot/grub/menu.lst' file under 'kopt=root'
update-grub
</pre>
